name: robocorp-code
description: Extension for Robot development in VSCode using Robocorp
author: Fabio Zadrozny

robocorp.language-server.tcp-port.description: If the port is specified, connect to the language server previously started at the given port. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robocorp.language-server.args.description: Specifies the arguments to be passed to the Robocorp Code language server (i.e.: ["-vv", "--log-file=~/robocorp_code.log"]). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robocorp.language-server.python.description: Specifies the path to the python executable to be used for the Robocorp Code Language Server (the default is searching python on the PATH). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robocorp.rcc.location.description: Specifies the location of the rcc tool.

robocorp.rcc.endpoint.description: Can be used to specify a different endpoint for rcc.

robocorp.rcc.config_location.description: Specifies the config location used by rcc.

robocorp.home.description: Specifies the value for ROBOCORP_HOME (where the conda environments will be downloaded). Must point to a directory without spaces in it.

robocorp.verifyLSP.description: Verify if the Robot Framework Language Server is installed?

robocorp.autoSetPythonExtensionInterpret.description: If a file in a Robot is opened, the python extension interpreter is automatically set to match the Robot interpreter.

robocorp.autoSetPythonExtensionDisableAc.description: Automatically sets the value of "python.terminal.activateEnvironment" to false to avoid wrong auto-activation when Robot terminal is created.

robocorp.proceedWithLongPathsDisabled.description: Enables Robocorp Code to be started even with long paths disabled.

robocorp.vaultTokenTimeoutInMinutes.description: Specifies the timeout in minutes for the token generated to access the vault when a launch is made. Note: max 60, min 5, additional timeout may be added internally to reuse the token in future runs (please use Robocorp Control Room or Robocorp Assistant for longer runs).

robocorp.codeLens.roboLaunch.description: Specifies whether the 'Run Task' and 'Debug Task' code lenses should be shown.

robocorp.actionServer.location.description: Specifies the location of the action-server executable.

robot.description: The robot.yaml file with the task to be launched.

task.description: The task name from the robot to be run.

args.description: Additional command line arguments for running the robot.

env.description: Environment variables to be added to the launch.

configurationSnippets.label: Robocorp Code: Launch task from robot.yaml
configurationSnippets.description: Add a new configuration for launching tasks from a robot.yaml.

body.name: Robocorp Code: Launch task from robot.yaml

commands.title: Upload Task Package (Robot) to Control Room
Set python executable based on robot.yaml
Unlink and remove credentials from Control Room
Upload Task Package (Robot) to Control Room
Open terminal with Task Package (Robot) environment
Lists the work items available for a Task Package (Robot)
Updates the environment variables used for some launch (given a Task Package (Robot))
Provides the environment variables related to the vault.
Convert output work item to input
Connect to Control Room Workspace (vault, storage, ...)
Sets the currently connected Control Room Workspace
Clear Robocorp (RCC) environments and restart Robocorp Code
Show error related to interpreter env creation
Conversion Accelerator from third party RPA to Robocorp Task Package (Robot)
Lists the actions available in an action package given a root dir (internal)

view/item/context.when: view == robocorp-package-resources-tree && viewItem == outputWorkItem || viewItem == inputWorkItem

scripts.vscode:prepublish: cd vscode-client && npm run compile && cd ..
